review_title: Great place to learn and grow as a nurse.
pros:

Family like feel. 
Great health benefits. 
Opportunity for advancement.
Scholarships and grants available to help tuition.

Limited resources as a small hospital.
Lack of formal educational programs.

pros: Small Hospital learn a lot

pros: It’s Local and they hire new graduates
cons: Poor management and always short staffed

pros: There is a positive vibe overall to this non-profit hospital. The fellow employees in all the different departments seem to get along well and are great to work with - I've seen good cohesiveness and collaboration; the HR support and motivational support employees receive are important. The Pros are: small perks include free snacks; Employee Awards and kudos are always uplifting; the CEO, Board Members, Directors, and Supervisors tend to be friendly; the atmosphere of MCH is a real home-town community feeling; and the patient care is satisfying. There is a sense of accomplishment to completing the work day.
cons: Being a relatively smaller size, rural community Hospital, we have benefits that are perhaps not as grand as other Hospitals around the local areas. We have a workload, as in other Hospitals, that seem to be great and may strain the staff to maximum capacity. This work is manageable and safe, but may be tiring. We have to work hard together to get the work done. If you're looking for easy, then look elsewhere.

pros: Co-workers are like family, great benefits, opportunities for advancement
cons: Pay isn't great, management isn't the best, ER doesn't deliver best care

review_title: Manager’ do not care.. Director acts like you waste his time!!
pros: Small hospital with everybody knows everybody and you can build some pretty cool friendships
cons: Managment will work do you like a dog and Not give it a second look . unless you kiss butt ,or are related to somebody don’t expect any kind of kudos praise or recognition. Managment listens to gossip and gets caught up in all the drama, favorite people get the full-time dayshift everybody else gets the leftovers. Manager is always talking about how unhappy she is, and how she’s looking for another job and recommends that the staff look elsewhere as well, but when the staff get another job, with much better pay they are told they can stay full-time or give a notice of resignation. There is no perdiem work available. (Even though perdiem is posted on indeed) I personally have seen this done to 3 separate people that have worked here over eight years!

job_title: Physical Therapist Assistant in Madera, CA
pros: MCH is a progressive hospital with a excellent team. The company thrives on  cohesion and teamwork. MCH has an excellent physical therapy that puts the patient's needs first.
cons: There are a limited number of physical therapy positions available due to the closing of the outpatient clinic. Hours of employment per day may be limited due to inpatient only.

pros: Good people to work with, but not enough of an incentive to stay.
cons: POOR MANAGEMENT!!!! Overworked, worst wages in the valley. If you kiss ass to the right people, they MIGHT NOT stab you in the back. The rules and policies DON'T APPLY TO MANAGEMENT STAFF OR IF YOU ARE RELATED TO THE RIGHT FAMILY. I only worked there a few months. MCH is a JOKE!
